attributes.action: introduce legislation to ban the operation of dog & pet rental companies
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A dog is no longer for life, but just for the weekend, with the launch of a 'rent a pet' service in the UK. 
An American company, has already signed up 100 'part-time owners' in London, but the scheme has been criticised by animal charities, who said that such 'time-share' schemes are cruel to the dogs involved.A leading pet charity has said: "When dogs are passed around, they may become confused, distressed and unpredictable." The Kennel Club added: "The concept of renting out dogs as a "timeshare" equivalent is detrimental to the dog." Legislation has already been introduced in Boston,USA to ban companies like this from operating & we need to do this in the UK before the company expands further.Flying in the face of the Animal Welfare Act 2007,this is nothing but a 'four-legged escort service',devaluing all parties and promoting the whole concept of no commitment.
